title: Body of missing woman found in concrete in Nevada desert before police charge two suspects
text:
A woman who has been missing for five months was found encased in concrete in the Nevada desert before police arrested two suspects in her murder.

Esmeralda Gonzalez, 24, was reported missing in Las Vegas by relatives on May 30 after she hadn't been heard from in several days.

Her remains were found in a 'homemade concrete and wooden structure' in a desert area north of the city on October 8. The cause of death is unclear.

Investigators said they received a tip implicating 45-year-old Christopher Prestipino in July and later determined that Gonzalez was held against her will inside the suspect's home before she was murdered.

Prestipino was arrested last week along with 31-year-old Lisa Mort, who allegedly knew about the killing and helped cover it up.

The body of 24-year-old Esmeralda Gonzalez (pictured) was found encased in concrete in the desert north of Las Vegas on October 8, five months after she was reported missing

Christopher Prestipino, 45, (left) was arrested last week and charged with Gonzalez's murder. Lisa Mort, 31, (right) was also arrested and charged with helping Prestipino cover up the killing

Both suspects are being held at the Clark County jail.

Prestipino is facing charges for murder, first-degree kidnapping resulting in substantial bodily harm, and conspiracy murder, according to jail records. He appeared in court on Wednesday morning.

Mort's charge is listed as 'harbor/conceal/aid felony offender'. She is set to appear in court on October 29.

Anyone with information about this case is urged to call Crime Stoppers at 702-385-5555.

Prestipino and Mort (above together in a Facebook photo) are being held at Clark County jail

Gonzalez was reported missing from her home on the 8900 block of Red Kansas Court (pictured) in Las Vegas by relatives on May 30

Throughout the five months since Gonzalez disappeared, her loved ones issued multiple pleas for the public's help in finding her.

'My family and I are worried sick. It's an agonizing and heart-wrenching feeling,' the victim's brother, Juan Gonzalez, told KTNV in late July.

'It's not like her to go missing like this. It's very shocking to us. We don't know where she could be. We don't know why she would leave.'

The brother said Gonzalez suffered from schizophrenia and bipolar disorder and had been off her medication in the weeks leading up to her disappearance.

'We feel it's very important for the public to understand how vulnerable she is,' he said.

The family have not spoken out since Gonzalez's body was found.

Anyone with information about this case is urged to call Crime Stoppers at 702-385-5555.
description: Christopher Prestipino, 45, and Lisa Mort, 31, were arrested on Friday after the remains of 24-year-old Esmeralda Gonzalez, who had been missing since May, were recovered north of Las Vegas.
